page.title: 13LANGUAGE USED IN CH.MINSHULL
page.content: This southern area of Cheshire has a basically North West Midland dialect, in which certain letters are exchanged in the spelling of{words,}and various sounds are similarly exchanged. Words are often shortened for example by the dropping of the letter H at the start of the word e.g.bonk-bank, mon-man, ommer-hammer, ond-hand, teel-tail, dee- day,feever-favour.{ {Place names}are also simplified and shortened e.g. Aulem- Audlem, Ooton- Oulton, Budorth- Budworth, Wembury- Wybunbury and Wetna-Wettenhall. Our village is called Minsha. Nearby is Chomson- Cholomondeston. Other words are thrutch-push, nowt- nothing, neet- night. Sentences can be severely abbreviated A winna tell thi- I will not tell you. Anna thee done up? - Are you not exhausted? Oo in tin- she is not at home.
